questions.text: Do you reside in the United States and are at least 18 years old?
questions.details: PoxApp may only be used by persons who reside in the United States and are at least 18 years old.

We are sorry, but PoxApp Stanford can currently only be offered to individuals who reside in the US and are at least 18 years old.

Click here to return to the PoxApp mainpage.

We are sorry, but PoxApp Stanford can currently only be offered to individuals who reside in the US and are at least 18 years old.

Click here to return to the PoxApp mainpage.

questions.text: Do you have a new skin or mucosal rash/lesion?
questions.details:
Please take a closer look in particular at the following locations of your body: Face, palms, soles, anogenital area and oral cavity.

Here are some examples:

Photo source: UK Health Security Agency

Please take or select a close-up and well-lit picture of your skin lesion.

Do not photograph your head or body parts with a tattoo or birth mark.
Select one or more of the symptoms below. If you do not have any of the symptoms, click on "Next".

Please measure your temperature with a thermometer.

The following types of measurements are possible:

In the oral cavity (oral, under the tongue), anus (rectal), armpit (axillary), and ear/forehead (digital thermometer).

If you do not have a thermometer, answer with"0".

questions.text: On which date did the symptoms first appear?
Have you had close contact with a person confirmed to be infected with monkeypox?
questions.details:
Close contact with a confirmed case means:
  • Direct, physical contact (touching, shaking hands, kissing).
  • Contact with or exchange of body fluids.
  • Sharing an apartment.
  • Contact with bedding (including "making the bed").

questions.text: What was the date of the last contact?
Have you had intimate contact with people outside of a relationship in the past 21 days?

results.text:
%(v_red)s Get tested.

Some users with your responses and similar skin lesion photos are infected with the monkeypox virus. You also report typical symptoms and you may have come into contact with the virus. PoxApp has detected characteristics in your skin lesion photo that are indicative of monkeypox. For further clarification, we recommend contacting your primary care physician, an infectious disease or tropical medicine facility by telephone and getting tested for monkeypox.

Please note: Performing a test is a medical decision made by a physician.

%(v_red)s Get tested.

Some users with your responses are infected with the monkeypox virus. PoxApp has not detected typical characteristics of monkeypox in your skin lesion photo. However, you report typical symptoms and you may have come into contact with the virus. For further clarification, we recommend contacting your primary care physician, an infectious disease or tropical medicine facility by telephone and getting tested for monkeypox.

Please note: Performing a test is a medical decision made by a physician.

%(v_red)s Get tested.

PoxApp has detected typical characteristics of monkeypox in your skin lesion photo and you also report typical symptoms. For further clarification, we recommend contacting your primary care physician, an infectious disease or tropical medicine facility by telephone and getting tested for monkeypox.

Please note: Performing a test is a medical decision made by a physician.

%(v_orange)s Get tested.

Few users with your responses are infected with the monkeypox virus. PoxApp has not detected typical characteristics of monkeypox in your skin lesion photo. However, you report typical symptoms and you have a skin lesion. For further clarification, we recommend contacting your primary care physician, an infectious disease or tropical medicine facility by telephone and getting tested for monkeypox.

Please note: Performing a test is a medical decision made by a physician.

%(v_orange)s Get tested.

Some users with your responses and similar skin lesion photos are infected with monkeypox. PoxApp has detected typical characteristics of monkeypox in your skin lesion photo. You have had a risk contact with an infected person. For further clarification, we recommend contacting your primary care physician, an infectious disease or tropical medicine facility by telephone and getting tested for monkeypox.

Please note: Performing a test is a medical decision made by a physician.

%(v_orange)s Get in touch with a local health department.

Some users with your responses are infected with monkeypox. PoxApp has not detected typical characteristics of monkeypox in your skin lesion photo. However, you have had a risk contact with an infected person. Please contact your local health department for further clarification.

%(v_orange)s Get in touch with a local health department.

Some users with your responses are infected with monkeypox. You don't have a skin lesion or typical symptoms. However, you have had a risk contact with an infected person. Please contact your local health department for further clarification.

%(v_orange)s Get tested.

Some users with similar skin lesion photos are infected with monkeypox. You responses indicate that you do not have typical symptoms and there has been no risk kontakt. However, PoxApp has detected typical characteristics of monkeypox in your skin lesion photo. For further clarification, we recommend contacting your primary care physician, an infectious disease or tropical medicine facility by telephone and getting tested for monkeypox.

Please note: Performing a test is a medical decision made by a physician.

%(v_orange)s Get in touch with a dermatologist.

Most users with your responses and similar skin lesion photos are not infected with monkeypox. You responses indicate that you do not have typical symptoms and there has been no risk kontakt. PoxApp has not detected typical characteristics of monkeypox in your skin lesion photo. However, there might be other skin conditions that might need medical treatment. For further clarification, please get in touch with a dermatologist.

%(v_orange)s Contact a doctor.

Most users with your responses are not infected with monkeypox. Your responses indicate symptoms without a skin lesion and there is no evidence that you may have been exposed to the monkeypox virus. If you develop further symptoms or a skin lesion, complete the survey of PoxApp again. If you currently feel ill, we recommend that you contact your primary care physician by phone.

%(v_green)s No further action required.

Most users with your responses are not infected with monkeypox and do not require further action.
